name: Havana Beach Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010
reviews.text: My wife and I ate at the Havana restaurant last night. A cuban sounding resort with an Indian restaurant? Anyway we had daal and a Greek salad. The daal tasted great and the salad was OK except the dressing wasn't Greek at all. Last night at 2 AM we both woke up very sick. Violent vomiting from both ends for almost 2 hours straight. Don't know which dish I'd us in but just wanted to let others know.
reviews.title: Food poisoning

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: The place looked very clean, well manicured, pool was immaculate, but only one other couple eating at the restaurant (low season). We are glad we didn't splurge on this place though as no rooms on beachfront and expensive. We are staying at the longtail just a few places down and have a bungalow on the beach, great food that doesn't make you sick, wonderful staff, all at a very fair price (590 baht/night).
reviews.title: Disappointing and over priced. Definitely not a "resort".

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I chose to stay with my family in Havana after reading all the good reviews on Trip Advisor, but was extremely disappointed.
reviews.title: Beautiful resort hotel right on the beach, the perfect stay in koh phangan

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is run-down, dirty, over-priced and completely deserted (besides us there was only one more occupied room). The word "resort" is ridiculous; "motel" is more fitting.
reviews.title: Laid back, friendly and perfect for a holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The hotel is situated on a hillside, so most rooms are quite far from the beach, with lots of stairs on the way.
reviews.title: Impeccable Service and Fun Galore!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I didn't stay here long enough to truly enjoy the full extent of the resort, but felt that the staff were very friendly and helpful and the grounds were well maintained. We also met the owner who was also friendly and seems very open to suggestions and feedback. a
reviews.title: Nice accomodation, friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was clean and didn't have any issues with strange smells in the bathroom as I've seen reported before, and this was after heavy flooding the week prior.
reviews.title: Best Holiday Destination EVER!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beach outside was very nice with soft sand, but we chose to go over to Noi a lot during the day since we liked the town on that side a bit better although both beaches are nice.
reviews.title: Havana Beach Resort - Tranquil, Comfort, Peaceful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: (Tips: We had a great breakfast at a place called Sala over on TNP Noi that I would recommend, but I suggest getting a ride over there during the day, because the walk up and over the hill can be a bit much in the sun. Also take a peak at the Santhiya resort for the nice wood carving details. You can access it easily via their private beach, you just need to follow the path that goes around the hill, past the small bungalows at the north end of the beach.)
reviews.title: Dark rooms, avarage hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled solo
reviews.text: My only nitpicks would be that I would have liked to see better door locks and better lighting to the upper floor units. Our section had a burnt out light at the bottom of the stairs, However our main issues was the exterior light at the top, as could not be turned on unless we were actually in the room. (It was connected to the key card system). At night it's almost pitch black, so I have no idea how the other guests on our floor managed getting down easily since the light was connected to our room. Bathrooms were a bit dark, but the only thing wrong was that the drain in the bathroom was actually higher then the rest of the tiles so water would pool for long periods of time.
reviews.title: Friendliest hotel I've experienced in a long time...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010
reviews.text: The Havana resort is one of my favourite hotels of all of those that I have stayed at in Thailand. The rooms are very spacious and very well furnished. Our bathroom was massive and with both bath and shower. The balcony was also huge and overlooked the little decorative waterfall and stream that runs down the centre of the hotel. The pool was lovely and clean, with plenty of sunloungers to go around. There was plenty of choice at breakfast and this could be eaten on the beach. The beach itself was probably the moct picturesque I have visited in Thailand. The whole place was very chilled out and I would definately return. The only slight negative comment is that it would appear that anywhere on Koh Phangan, you have to wait a while for your food to be served.
reviews.title: Wonderful beachfront hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was indeed the most expensive hotel we stayed in Thailand!However we have to say that the room were clean and pleasant but the highlight was the staff: they were all super!when we arrived my boyfriend realized he lost his wallet with documents and cards and the receptionist and her manager really moved all the island to find it: they called police, pier station, taxi drivers, checked hotels' cameras and finally the day after the wallet came back intact! the people at the havana really look after you!and they love party too! ;-P
reviews.title: great staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the only problem we encounter is the transport:it is really expensive and from the pier to the hotel you can get a share taxi x 250-300thb but when you're there if you wish to get back to the city down south you've got only few share taxi a day (around 10am) or the private car option which will cost you 1500thb (same if you rent your own car x a whole day).Around full-moon dates prices double!!!however if,like we did,you rent a scooter it will cost you only 200thb x day, bear in mind though that road are really tough!!!...also food is quite expensive!FORGET CHEAP THAI PRICES!
reviews.title: Lovely resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at Havana in December 2010 with my girlfriend and we had a lovely time. The location is excellent - right on the beautiful Ao Thong Nai Pan. The rooms are clean and comfortable enough for the money you pay, I would say they are good value for money. The staff are lovely and friendly and the food is really nice at the resort's bar. The pool is really nice and the view up to the hills behind the resort is amazing. The breakfast is OK - i asked for fresh eggs every day and they were cooked however you like. If I returned to Koh Phangan and was on a budget I would definitely stay at Havana agiain.
reviews.title: Absolutely wonderful resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I stayed at Havana for about 5 days during our 2 week vacation in Thailand. We mostly stayed at large resorts from big chain hotels, like Renaissance Marriot in Koh Samui and Hilton in Phuket. Havana was definitely our favorite because of the friendly hospitality and cozy atmosphere.
reviews.title: Great Hotel If you are looking to relax

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the moment we where picked up at Tongsala Pier the people from the Hotel where very friendly like, trying to get to know us, since visitors from Ecuador are not too common around Thailand. The hotel was great, the food was really good, the service and the staff where great and trying to satisfy at all times! The only thing we did not enjoy off was that the there where high tides and the beach was full of trash everyday, we had to move to "Noi: the other beach to get in the sea, is a 20 minute hike, out of that the place is great!
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We are travelling Thailand for 3 months now. We've seen many beautiful places and a couple of the best Resorts, Hotels & Guesthouses you can get for "normal" Money in whole Thailand.
reviews.title: Never again!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We've been from the north to the south. FInally we would say we know what you can expect from a good Trip in Thailand and a good Hotel or Resort down here.
reviews.title: Will Do It Again!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: The Havana Beach Resort was the most expensive Hotel since our Trip started and I'm afraid to say, yes it was the worst Hotel we used to stay.
reviews.title: Charming Resort. Amazing Service. Absolute Paradise.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: It began with the Transfer. They want you to pay 800 Baht to take you from Pier to the Havana per pax!! We took an average taxi at the pier and paid 200 Baht per pax ;-)!
reviews.title: The unforgettable!

description: We are located at the best beach in Koh Phangan. We offer a variety of food from Asian cuisine (Thai, Indian, Chinese etc.) to European cuisine (Italian, French, Italian etc.). Our rooms are brand new and our Fidel's bar has all of the varieties of drink that you can think of!
